TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EntityDataReader extends System.Data.Common.DbDataReader implements class System.Data.IDataRecord, class System.Data.IExtendedDataRecord
Public Class EntityDataReader Inherits DbDataReader Implements IExtendedDataRecord
public ref class EntityDataReader : System::Data::Common::DbDataReader, System::Data::IExtendedDataRecord
type EntityDataReader = class inherit DbDataReader interface IExtendedDataRecord interface IDataRecord

Docs.summary: Reads a forward-only stream of rows from a data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Combines the functionality of the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader> class and the <xref:System.Data.IExtendedDataRecord> interface.
An <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader> has no public constructor. It can only be obtained through one of the `EntityCommand.ExecuteReader` method overloads.
SQL Server puts output parameters from stored procedures at the end of the result stream, after all the result sets. Therefore, to get output parameter values, an application must consume all the records in all the result sets. If the application closes the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader> (which would also close the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader>), output parameters might not be populated.
<xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader> does not implicitly consume result sets to make output parameters available. Therefore, note the following:
- <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader> calls the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader.NextResult%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> only when <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader.NextResult%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> is explicitly called. If <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader.NextResult%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> throws an exception, the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader> will wrap it in an <xref:System.Data.EntityException> (or a derived exception).
- <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader.Close%2A> only closes the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader>, without consuming any pending records or result sets.
- <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader.Dispose%2A> only disposes of the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader>, without consuming any pending records or result sets.
For code examples, see [Working with EntityClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dec4728c-8dff-4e30-abe0-0f78fb5d5af5).

If <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader.NextResult%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> throws an exception, <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader> will wrap it in <xref:System.Data.EntityException> (or a derived exception).

remarks.format:
## Remarks SQL Server puts output parameters from stored procedures at the end of the result stream, after all the result sets. Therefore, to get output parameter values, an application must consume all the records in all the result sets. If the application closes the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader> (which would also close the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader>), output parameters might not be populated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool NextResult() cil managed
Public Overrides Function NextResult () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Advances the reader to the next result when reading the results of a batch of statements.
Docs.returns: if there are more result sets; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method allows you to process multiple result sets returned when a batch is submitted to the data provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Read() cil managed
Public Overrides Function Read () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Advances the reader to the next record in a result set.
Docs.returns: if there are more rows; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default position of a data reader is before the first record. Therefore, you must call `Read` to begin accessing data.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property RecordsAffected As Integer
public: virtual property int RecordsAffected { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted by execution of the SQL statement.
Docs.value: The number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted. Returns -1 for SELECT statements; 0 if no rows were affected or the statement failed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `RecordsAffected` property is not set until all rows are read and you close the `DataReader`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property VisibleFieldCount As Integer
public: virtual property int VisibleFieldCount { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of fields in the that are not hidden.
Docs.value: The number of fields that are not hidden.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value is used to determine how many fields in the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityDataReader> are visible. For example, a SELECT on a partial primary key returns the remaining parts of the key as hidden fields. The hidden fields are always appended behind the visible fields.
